name: Engineering Principles
description: Understand and follow basic engineering expectations, including unblocking teammates when necessary and correctly prioritizing tasks.

name: Functional Programming – Basic Concepts
description: Understand functional programming paradigms, including immutability, pure functions, and composition.

name: Microservices Architecture
description: Understand how microservices architecture works, including its advantages in scalability, flexibility, and maintainability.

name: Diplomat Architecture
description: Understand and apply the Diplomat architecture pattern used in Nubank's backend services.

name: Clojure – Fundamentals
description: Master basic syntax, data structures, and core functions in Clojure.

name: REPL-Driven Development
description: Apply interactive development using REPL to test and refine code incrementally.

name: Pure Functions
description: Write deterministic functions that produce the same result for the same arguments without side effects.

name: Higher-Order Functions
description: Use functions like map, filter, reduce and create functions that take or return other functions.

name: Structural Editing (Paredit)
description: Efficiently manipulate Clojure code using structural editing to maintain structural integrity.

name: Docstrings and Documentation
description: Write clear and useful documentation for functions, macros, and variables in Clojure code.

name: Idempotency
description: Implement operations that can be applied multiple times with the same result.

name: Immutability
description: Work effectively with immutable data structures to ensure predictable and concurrency-safe code.

name: Plumatic Schemas
description: Validate data structures using Plumatic Schemas to ensure runtime correctness.

name: Clojure Spec
description: Explore how to define specifications to validate data and test functions.

name: Common Components and Libraries
description: Use common Nubank components and libraries to manage the lifecycle of software components.

name: Unit Testing
description: Write tests for individual functions to verify specific behaviors.

name: Integration Testing (state-flow)
description: Implement tests that verify component interaction using state-flow.

name: Sachem (Contract Testing)
description: Ensure that payloads produced by one service can be consumed by another service.

name: Leiningen
description: Manage Clojure projects, including dependencies, compilation, and testing.

name: Kafka Basics
description: Understand the basic operation of Kafka as a distributed streaming platform.

name: Datomic – Basic Queries
description: Use the Datalog language to query data in Datomic.

name: HTTP – Pedestal Interceptors
description: Implement interceptors to modularize HTTP request processing.

name: Observability – Basic Concepts
description: Monitor and understand the internal state of a system through logs, metrics, and traces.

name: Splunk – Basic Queries
description: Perform basic queries to analyze application logs.

name: AWS – Basic Services
description: Be familiar with the main AWS services used at Nubank.

name: Security – Personal Data and PII
description: Understand and apply practices for protecting personal data and personally identifiable information.

name: Correlation ID
description: Use correlation IDs to trace requests and events in distributed systems.

name: Event-Driven Architecture
description: Implement systems that communicate asynchronously through events.

name: Terraform
description: Understand the basic principles of infrastructure as code with Terraform.

name: Experimentation
description: Use the experimentation platform to measure the impact of changes.

name: Tolerant Readers
description: Implement data consumers that accept extra fields and require only what's necessary.
